abstract.original_text: In modern bioinformatics, finding an efficient way to allocate sequence fragments with biological functions is an important issue. This paper presents a structural approach based on context-free grammars extracted from original DNA or protein sequences. This approach is radically different from all those statistical methods. Furthermore, this approach is compared with a topological entropy-based method for consistency and difference of the complexity results.

sentences.segment_text: In modern bioinformatics , finding an efficient way to allocate sequence fragments with biological functions is an important issue .
This paper presents a structural approach based on context-free grammars extracted from original DNA or protein sequences .
This approach is radically different from all those statistical methods .
Furthermore , this approach is compared with a topological entropy-based method for consistency and difference of the complexity results .
